name: Linton Kwesi Johnson
description: '''Linton Kwesi Johnson''' [[Order of Distinction|OD]] (born 24 August 1952), also known as '''LKJ''', is a Jamaica-born, British-based [[dub poetry|dub poet]] and activist. In 2002, he became the second living poet, and the only black one, to be published in the [[Penguin Classics|Penguin Modern Classics]] series. His [[performance poetry]] involves the recitation of his own verse in [[Jamaican patois]] over [[Dub music|dub]]-[[reggae]], usually written in collaboration with reggae producer/artist [[Dennis Bovell]].
